content: single-layer of petals example photo taken after my dog got a hold of it for a chew toy but it regained its shape pretty acceptably https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store i designed the center disc to puff up quite a bit again this varies among different daisy types so if you prefer a flatter center just remove one or two of the row of 12 single_crochet before doing the blo rounds go wild if you want the center discs of gerbera or african daisies for example are more textured and have more color variation i haven t designed anything specifically for that but maybe someday i did do a textured center disc for my sunflower pattern which is constructed similarly they are family after all as noted in the pattern you can make stems or just the blooms depending on how/where you want to use them you could also make them much smaller using lighter weight yarn and smaller hooks if you wanted to make one as an applique on a hat for example below are two examples the wreath features my test daisies as i was working out the pattern the bouquet features my full flower stems please please don t eat the daisies ~ 6 ~ daisy crochet pattern by susanna the sunflower and butterfly on the wreath are also my own designs see links to the patterns written by others used for the wreath oak leaves lily of the valley bird carnation on its ravelry project page https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store ~ 7 ~
